chunks.content: Order Entry (Option 1) is for NEW orders with next day delivery (except Friday-Saturday). Enter operator number, then customer number (or type name to search). For multiple ship-to addresses, enter '?' and hit Enter to cycle through, press F4 to accept. Enter PO in Reference Number field if required, or Enter to skip. Use arrow keys to select delivery date per transportation guidelines.

What if the customer I'm entering has multiple ship-to addresses?
In OE Option 1, how do I cycle through ship-tos with '?' and hit F4 to accept?

Do I have to enter the PO in the Reference Number field, or can I skip it?
chunks.quality_reasoning: Core order entry process for new next-day orders, clear step-by-step navigation, mostly self-contained but references external guidelines.

jargon.Order Entry: System module (Option 1) for entering new customer orders
jargon.ship-to addresses: Multiple delivery addresses associated with a customer
jargon.operator number: Unique identifier for the user or operator
jargon.Reference Number field: Designated field for entering purchase order or reference details
jargon.transportation guidelines: Company rules dictating allowable delivery dates based on transport schedules

chunks.content: In an open order: 'L' + Enter = Look Up (customer's order history). Spacebar searches within history, sorted by last order date. 'X' or down arrow exits history. 'A' + Enter = Alpha search for all products (new items). In Alpha: enter line number to select item. Blue highlighted items = previously purchased by customer.

chunks.quality_reasoning: Core order entry process for product lookup, clear keystroke steps, self-contained for common scenario

jargon.open order: A system mode or screen for entering or managing ongoing customer orders
jargon.Look Up: Function to view a customer's order history, accessed via 'L' + Enter
jargon.Alpha search: Alphabetical search for all products including new items, accessed via 'A' + Enter in open order
jargon.line number: Numeric identifier for items in search results, entered to select an item
jargon.Blue highlighted items: Products previously purchased by the customer, visually distinguished in the search

chunks.content: After selecting item, enter case count (or Enter for 1 case). To SPLIT a case: enter quantity, then press LEFT ARROW key. F1 after item selection (before qty) shows stock status. Up arrow in stock status shows incoming orders/transfers from Amsterdam. Down arrow shows committed quantity.

jargon.case: Unit of item packaging or counting (e.g., a box or carton)
jargon.SPLIT a case: Procedure to divide a full case into a partial quantity by entering amount and pressing LEFT ARROW key
jargon.stock status: Inventory information displayed by pressing F1 after item selection (before quantity)
jargon.Up arrow: Indicator in stock status for incoming orders or transfers (e.g., from Amsterdam)
jargon.Down arrow: Indicator in stock status for committed quantity
jargon.committed quantity: Amount of stock reserved or allocated to existing orders

default_case_count.context: Default when pressing Enter after item selection without specifying count

chunks.content: To UNDO price, quantity, or item: press UP ARROW to go back. To DELETE wrong item: press F4 (change mode), enter 'D' on qty line, press F4 again to return to ADD mode. Order number appears at top right after first item accepted - always write it down.

chunks.quality_reasoning: Core order entry editing procedures for frequent error correction; highly actionable keystroke instructions, self-contained with minimal assumptions beyond basic system access.

jargon.UP ARROW: Key to undo price, quantity, or item entry
jargon.F4: Function key to change modes (e.g., to DELETE or back to ADD)
jargon.qty line: Line for entering or modifying quantity in item entry
jargon.ADD mode: Default mode for adding items to the order
jargon.DELETE: Mode for removing wrong items (entered as 'D' on qty line)
jargon.Order number: Unique identifier displayed at top right after first item accepted

chunks.content: In order: 'R' = redisplay all items. F2 = Detail History (full customer order history). UP ARROW exits order and shows Net Income, GP%, GP$, cases, splits. At print prompt: Y=Yes (line version), N=No, U=Uniform (customer version), E=Excel version.

chunks.content: Invoice Entry is for same-day Cash & Carry pickups OR invoicing customers for received product. Same steps as Option 1 with extras: prompted for pickup time (enter as 12:30 or 12.30). Both order number AND invoice number appear. Used to send order to Food Depot for picking.

jargon.Food Depot: Facility or department where orders are sent for picking

chunks.content: Invoice Entry print sequence: Y=Yes to print, T=Temperature Zone (helps warehouse efficiency), 29=Cash & Carry printer, N=don't show GP, Y=show prices. This sends order to Cash & Carry. If only invoicing (no pickup), no need to send to printer.

jargon.Invoice Entry print sequence: Field controlling print options (Y=print, T=Temperature Zone, 29=Cash & Carry printer, N=don't show GP, Y=show prices)
jargon.Cash & Carry: Order destination/printer (code 29) for cash and carry operations
jargon.GP: Item not to show on print (likely Gross Profit)
jargon.Temperature Zone: Print code that helps warehouse efficiency

chunks.content: Order/Invoice Inquiry/Correction (Option 3) returns to previously entered orders. Shipped orders from last 48 hours are viewable but NOT changeable. chunks.content: In Order Inquiry: Enter=totals, A=add items, C=change (qty/price) or Delete, F3=next open order, R=review/update order, L=review in entry order. IMPORTANT: To reduce case count, you MUST delete the item then re-add with correct count. Reducing without delete/add causes shortage on invoice.

jargon.open order: Order that is pending or not yet completed
jargon.entry order: Sequence in which items were originally entered
jargon.shortage on invoice: Discrepancy where invoiced quantity is less than expected due to improper adjustment

chunks.content: Order/Invoice Header Correction (Option 4) adjusts OPEN order info (not yet invoiced/shipped). Enter order number, then line number to adjust (e.g., #17 for PO Number). Lines 22-24 add remarks that show on invoice (e.g., 'Driver Pick Up Check'). DATE CHANGES must go to Routing & Customer Service Supervisor.

jargon.remarks: Notes added to specific lines (22-24) that appear on the invoice

chunks.content: Back Order Entry (Option 34) enters next-day delivery for shorted/mispicked product from current day's delivery. Allows small qty deliveries without affecting margin. Same as Option 1 but: Reference Number = previous ORDER#. FIRST item MUST be from previous order or system rejects. Saturday back orders require John Levatino approval.

jargon.Back Order Entry: Process using Option 34 to enter next-day delivery for shorted or mispicked product from current day's delivery
jargon.shorted: Product delivered in lesser quantity than ordered
jargon.margin: Profit margin (small qty back order deliveries do not affect it)
jargon.Reference Number: Field that must be set to the previous order number
jargon.back orders: Entries for delivery of shorted or mispicked items from a previous order

Extended price may be incorrect - warehouse adjusts cut weight before shipping.

chunks.content: Special Order process: Start order with customer#, enter item#, Y to place special order (N to cancel), enter requested receive date, enter cancel date (latest acceptable). Exit order. Item is now allocated - buyers can't add to PO unless allocated (shown shaded). Buyers receive daily Excel of all special orders. Sales reps get their allocations only.
synthetic_questions: How do I place a special order in order entry?
What dates do I need to enter when starting a special order?

chunks.quality_reasoning: Core special order process in order entry; clear steps make it highly actionable and mostly self-contained, requires basic system familiarity

jargon.Special Order: Custom order process starting with customer number, item number, confirmation (Y/N), requested receive date, and cancel date, resulting in item allocation
jargon.allocated: Item status where it is reserved for a special order, preventing buyers from adding it to a PO (visually indicated as shaded)
jargon.buyers: Procurement staff who manage purchase orders and receive daily Excel reports of special orders
jargon.sales reps: Sales representatives who receive visibility only to their own allocations
jargon.shaded: Visual indicator in the system showing an item is allocated and restricted
jargon.allocations: Reserved items for special orders, accessible differently to buyers and sales reps
jargon.customer#: Customer identifier or number used to start a special order
jargon.item#: Item identifier or number entered in the special order process
jargon.requested receive date: Desired delivery date specified for the special order
jargon.cancel date: Latest acceptable date for receiving the special order

chunks.content: Special Order management: Buyers must communicate if item discontinued or unavailable within dates. Sales reps manage their list - can remove items from SLS screen (only if not yet ordered by Purchasing). Buyer gets email notification when removed. Reasons to remove: customer out of business, credit hold, etc.

jargon.SLS screen: System interface for sales reps to remove items from their special order lists (before Purchasing orders them)
jargon.Purchasing: Department responsible for placing orders with suppliers
